TopicTitle: Noob seeks advice: Access denied message

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I need an advise concerning the following issue:

I did want to read the first of the linked threads in this thread http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92080-x64-force-opengl-doesnt-work (linked by user custume) and ran into this message:

E.Nygma, you do not have permission to access this page. This could be due to one of several reasons:

Your user account may not have sufficient privileges to access this page. Are you trying to edit someone else's post, access administrative features or some other privileged system?

If you are trying to post, the administrator may have disabled your account, or it may be awaiting activation.

Is there a reason like my status as 'Bottle Rocketeer' behind this or what have I encounter here?

Thanks for clarification!

Regards

Edited September 12, 2014 by E.Nygma
Question answered

That's one of the many threads that was moved to an archive following the Support section restructuring. Not much there to be found, really, custume just posted a couple of links for the user who had a problem with -force-opengl not working for them. He did, however post links to this thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86893-V0-24-0-Multicore-processor-issues-and-solutions-%28x86-x64%29

There was one other link, too, but that thread seems to have completely vanished.

Hope that helps.

Ah, I had noticed the new structure but didn't make the connection. Thank you very much! Could you be so kind and close this thread? Thanks again!

Edited September 12, 2014 by E.Nygma
